articles.description: Having waited so long for one, Xander Schauffele has won two majors in two months. Now he is eyeing a career grand slam.
articles.title: The Open 2024: Xander Schauffele eyes career slam after Royal Troon triumph

articles.description: Shoaib Bashir takes 5-41 as England surge towards a series victory by blowing away West Indies in a single session on the fourth day of the second Test at Trent Bridge.
articles.title: England vs West Indies: Shoaib Bashir takes 5-41 as hosts win second Test at Trent Bridge

articles.description: Lando Norris agonised over whether to hand victory in the Hungarian Grand Prix back to team-mate Oscar Piastri but said it was the “fair" and “honest” thing to do.
articles.title: Lando Norris: I didn’t give up the win. I lost it off the line

articles.description: Xander Schauffele wins second major of his career with a two-shot victory over Justin Rose and Billy Horschel.
articles.title: The Open 2024: Xander Schauffele holds of Justin Rose to win Claret Jug at Royal Troon

articles.description: Tadej Pogocar seals a sensational Tour de France-Giro d'Italia double by winning stage 21's time trial into Nice.
articles.title: Tour de France 2024: Tadej Pogacar wins third title with time trial victory

articles.description: Luke Humphries adds the World Matchplay title to his World Championship crown with a thrilling 18-15 defeat of Michael van Gerwen.
articles.title: World Matchplay: Luke Humphries beats Michael van Gerwen to win title

articles.description: Captain Ben Stokes says Shoaib Bashir “has shown the world what he can do” after bowling England to victory in the second Test against West Indies.
articles.title: England vs West Indies: Shoaib Bashir 'showed the world what he can do' - Ben Stokes

articles.description: Max Verstappen says Red Bull “need to do a better job” and that he sees no need to apologise for a series of bad-tempered radio messages during the Hungarian Grand Prix.
articles.title: Max Verstappen: Red Bull need to do better

articles.description: Liverpool Under-18s leave the pitch in two games after a player alleges he is racially abused during a tournament in Germany.
articles.title: Liverpool U18s walk off pitch twice after alleged racist abuse in Germany

articles.description: Legendary British cyclist Mark Cavendish says this year's Tour de France is likely to be his last ever race.
articles.title: Mark Cavendish: Briton says Tour de France 'likely' to be his last ever race
